## Act IV: The Final Takeover

### Location: Hamburg Rathaus - Central Command Center

December 23rd. Christmas Eve is tomorrow.

You arrive at the Rathaus to find the Central Command Center transformed. The Grinch is already there, along with Stadtrat Fischer and Frau Weber.

"Before tomorrow's finale," the Grinch explains, "there's one more system: Hamburg's monitoring network. It uses logarithmic scaling—the mathematics of measurement. Sound levels. Structural stress. Anything that spans orders of magnitude."

> "Logarithms are the inverse of exponentials. Where exponentials describe growth, logarithms describe scale. They compress vast ranges into manageable numbers.
>
> Hamburg's monitoring systems need logarithmic functions because they handle everything from whisper-quiet neighborhoods to festival crowd noise. From minor tremors to major structural vibrations.
>
> This is the last mathematical concept before tomorrow's synthesis. Master logarithms, and every system in Hamburg will be under unified control.
>
> One more day after this. Let's make it count."

## The Challenge

::: {.scenario-block}

Four logarithmic problems controlling Hamburg's monitoring infrastructure.

**System 1: "The Decibel Protocol"**

Hamburg's noise monitoring uses:

$$S = 10 \cdot \log_{10}\left(\frac{I}{I_0}\right)$$

At the Rathausmarkt Christmas market, the sound intensity ratio is $\frac{I}{I_0} = 1000$.

> **Grinch's Note:** "Logarithms ask a simple question: 'What power?' A thousand is a round number in base 10. Think about why."

**What is the sound level in decibels?**

**System 2: "The Natural Log Access Code"**

The final security layer uses:

$$\ln(x + 5) = 3$$

(Use: $e^3 \approx 20.09$)

> **Grinch's Note:** "Logarithms and exponentials are inverse operations. What one does, the other undoes. Apply that principle."

**What is $x$ (approximately)?**

::: {.puzzle-box}

**System 3: "The Degradation Model"**

The Köhlbrandbrücke bridge has stress sensors following:

$$S(t) = 100 - 20 \cdot \log_2(t + 1)$$

where $t$ is hours since last maintenance check.

> **Grinch's Note:** "Time passes. Structures age. The logarithm measures decay. Seven hours—consider what happens to the argument."

**What is the strength index after 7 hours?**

::: {.puzzle-box}
<div class="quiz-options">

  <button class="quiz-option" data-correct="false"> 80 </button>
  <button class="quiz-option" data-correct="false"> 60 </button>
  <button class="quiz-option" data-correct="true"> 40 </button>
</div>

<div class="quiz-actions">
  <p class="quiz-feedback"></p>
  <button class="quiz-submit" disabled>Check Structural Status</button>
</div>
:::

**System 4: "The Transformed Monitor"**

The base monitoring function $f(x) = \ln(x)$ has been shifted RIGHT by 3 units and UP by 2 units.

> **Grinch's Note:** "Transformations shift the boundaries. The original function has a wall at zero. Where does that wall move when everything shifts?"

**What is the vertical asymptote of the transformed function?**

You submit the logarithmic solutions:

The monitoring network activates. Across Hamburg, sensors come online—sound monitors, structural stress detectors, crowd analyzers—all using logarithmic scaling.

The main screen shows a unified dashboard: every Christmas market, every bridge, every system, all monitored and controlled.

The Grinch watches with visible satisfaction:

Tomorrow is the finale.
